title: Citi Kenya Plants Trees to Commemorate Kenya Jubilee Celebrations
summary: Nairobi - Citi Kenya partnered with the Green Belt Movement (GBM) in a tree planting initiative at the Ngong Forest in Nairobi on December 6, 2013. The Citi Kenya Green Team and the Green Belt Movement organized and coordinated the initiative, and Citi Kenya staff, a representative from the Kenya Bankers Association (KBA) and the Kenya Forest Service (KFS) attended.
tag-1: Citi Kenya Plants Trees to Commemorate Kenya Jubilee Celebrations
tag-2: Nairobi – Citi Kenya partnered with the Green Belt Movement (GBM) in a tree planting initiative at the Ngong Forest in Nairobi on December 6, 2013. The Citi Kenya Green Team and the Green Belt Movement organized and coordinated the initiative, and Citi Kenya staff, a representative from the Kenya Bankers Association (KBA) and the Kenya Forest Service (KFS) attended.
tag-3: The Kenya @50 steering committee called upon organizations to participate in the tree-planting initiative, with the campaign aiming to achieve 50 million trees planted as the country marked the first jubilee celebrations since gaining independence. Citi Kenya made a contribution of $5,700 to facilitate the project and 1,200 tree seedlings were planted.
tag-4: "Congratulations to Citi for coordinating and facilitating this initiative. Planting trees benefits the occasion as it will ensure that the celebration leaves a legacy for the Citi Kenya Team, as well as the Green Belt Movement," said Ms. Nuru Mugambi, Head of Public Affairs at the Kenya Bankers Association (KBA).
tag-5: The tree planting campaign by the Kenya @50 steering committee was one of many activities that were lined up to mark the grand occasion where organizations as well as individuals were encouraged to plant as many trees as possible to help the country towards reaching the United Nation's recommendation of 10 percent forest cover by 2030. In the words of founder of the Green Belt Movement and the 2004 Nobel Peace Prize Laureate Wangari Maathai: "Those of us who have been privileged to receive education, skills, and experiences and even power must be role models for the next generation of leadership… We want to see many planting trees. There is absolutely no excuse to not stop desertification because this is something that is doable and cheap."
